alert.note: Alert for Carbon; Monroe (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 25 at 6:24PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Pennsylvania...including the following counties...Carbon and Monroe. * WHEN...Until 845 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 624 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly across portions of the advisory area. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Mount Pocono, Tobyhanna, Long Pond, Pocono Raceway, Pocono Pines, Sun Valley, McMichael, Jonas, Meckesville, Brodheadsville, Gilbert, and Gouldsboro State Park. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 290 and 299. Interstate 380 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 10. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous after heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
